g5201.definition: [ὑδρία] from {{g5204}}; a water-jar, i.e. receptacle for family supply

g5202.definition: [ὑδροποτέω] from a compound of {{g5204}} and a derivative of {{g4095}}; to be a water-drinker, i.e. to abstain from vinous beverages

g5203.definition: [ὑδρωπικός] from a compound of {{g5204}} and a derivative of {{g3700}} (as if looking watery); to be "dropsical"

g5204.definition: [ὕδωρ] ,   and genitive case,      ὕδατος, etc. from the base of {{g5205}}; water (as if rainy) literally or figuratively

g5205.definition: [ὑετός] from a primary ὕω (to rain); rain, especially a shower

g5206.definition: [υἱοθεσία] from a presumed compound of {{g5207}} and a derivative of {{g5087}}; the placing as a son, i.e. adoption (figuratively, Christian sonship in respect to God)

g5207.definition: [υἱός] apparently a primary word; a "son" (sometimes of animals), used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship

g5208.definition: [ὕλη] perhaps akin to {{g3586}}; a forest, i.e. (by implication) fuel

g5209.definition: [ὑμᾶς] accusative case of {{g5210}}; you (as the objective of a verb or preposition)

g5210.definition: [ὑμεῖς] irregular plural of {{g4771}}; you (as subjective of verb)

g5211.definition: [Ὑμεναῖος] from Ὑμήν (the god of weddings); "hymenæal"; Hymenæus, an opponent of Christianity

g5212.definition: [ὑμέτερος] from {{g5210}}; yours, i.e. pertaining to you

g5213.definition: [ὑμῖν] irregular dative case of {{g5210}}; to (with or by) you

g5214.definition: [ὑμνέω] from {{g5215}}; to hymn, i.e. sing a religious ode; by implication, to celebrate (God) in song

g5215.definition: [ὕμνος] apparently from a simpler (obsolete) form of ὑδέω (to celebrate; probably akin to {{g103}}; compare {{h5667}}); a "hymn" or religious ode (one of the Psalms)

g5216.definition: [ὑμῶν] genitive case of {{g5210}}; of (from or concerning) you

g5217.definition: [ὑπάγω] from {{g5259}} and {{g71}}; to lead (oneself) under, i.e. withdraw or retire (as if sinking out of sight), literally or figuratively

g5218.definition: [ὑπακοή] from {{g5219}}; attentive hearkening, i.e. (by implication) compliance or submission

g5219.definition: [ὑπακούω] from {{g5259}} and {{g191}}; to hear under (as a subordinate), i.e. to listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority

g5220.definition: [ὕπανδρος] from {{g5259}} and {{g435}}; in subjection under a man, i.e. a married woman

g5221.definition: [ὑπαντάω] from {{g5259}} and a derivative of {{g473}}; to go opposite (meet) under (quietly), i.e. to encounter, fall in with

g5222.definition: [ὑπάντησις] from {{g5221}}; an encounter or concurrence (with {{g1519}} for infinitive, in order to fall in with)

g5223.definition: [ὕπαρξις] from {{g5225}}; existency or proprietorship, i.e. (concretely) property, wealth

g5224.definition: [ὑπάρχοντα] neuter plural of present participle active of {{g5225}} as noun; things extant or in hand, i.e. property or possessions

g5225.definition: [ὑπάρχω] from {{g5259}} and {{g756}}; to begin under (quietly), i.e. come into existence (be present or at hand); expletively, to exist (as copula or subordinate to an adjective, participle, adverb or preposition, or as an auxiliary to a principal (verb)

g5226.definition: [ὑπείκω] from {{g5259}} and εἴκω (to yield, be "weak"); to surrender

g5227.definition: [ὑπεναντίος] from {{g5259}} and {{g1727}}; under (covertly) contrary to, i.e. opposed or (as noun) an opponent

g5228.definition: [ὑπέρ] a primary preposition; "over", i.e. (with the genitive case) of place, above, beyond, across, or causal, for the sake of, instead, regarding; with the accusative case superior to, more than In the comparative, it retains many of the above applications.

g5229.definition: [ὑπεραίρομαι] middle voice from {{g5228}} and {{g142}}; to raise oneself over, i.e. (figuratively) to become haughty

g5230.definition: [ὑπέρακμος] from {{g5228}} and the base of {{g188}}; beyond the "acme", i.e. figuratively (of a daughter) past the bloom (prime) of youth

g5231.definition: [ὑπεράνω] from {{g5228}} and {{g507}}; above upward, i.e. greatly higher (in place or rank)

g5232.definition: [ὑπεραυξάνω] from {{g5228}} and {{g837}}; to increase above ordinary degree

g5233.definition: [ὑπερβαίνω] from {{g5228}} and the base of {{g939}}; to transcend, i.e. (figuratively) to overreach

g5234.definition: [ὑπερβαλλόντως] adverb from present participle active of {{g5235}}; excessively

g5235.definition: [ὑπερβάλλω] from {{g5228}} and {{g906}}; to throw beyod the usual mark, i.e. (figuratively) to surpass (only active participle supereminent)

g5236.definition: [ὑπερβολή] from {{g5235}}; a throwing beyond others, i.e. (figuratively) supereminence; adverbially (with {{g1519}} or {{g2596}}) pre- eminently

g5237.definition: [ὑπερείδω] from {{g5228}} and {{g1492}}; to overlook, i.e. not punish

g5238.definition: [ὑπερέκεινα] from {{g5228}} and the neuter plural of {{g1565}}; above those parts, i.e. still farther

g5240.definition: [ὑπερεκχύνω] from {{g5228}} and the alternate form of {{g1632}}; to pour out over, i.e. (passively) to overflow

g5241.definition: [ὑπερεντυγχάνω] from {{g5228}} and {{g1793}}; to intercede in behalf of

g5242.definition: [ὑπερέχω] from {{g5228}} and {{g2192}}; to hold oneself above, i.e. (figuratively) to excel; participle (as adjective, or neuter as noun) superior, superiority

g5244.definition: [ὑπερήφανος] from {{g5228}} and {{g5316}}; appearing above others (conspicuous), i.e. (figuratively) haughty

g5245.definition: [ὑπερνικάω] from {{g5228}} and {{g3528}}; to vanquish beyond, i.e. gain a decisive victory

g5246.definition: [ὑπέρογκος] from {{g5228}} and {{g3591}}; bulging over, i.e. (figuratively) insolent

g5247.definition: [ὑπεροχή] from {{g5242}}; prominence, i.e. (figuratively) superiority (in rank or character)

g5251.definition: [ὑπερυψόω] from {{g5228}} and {{g5312}}; to elevate above others, i.e. raise to the highest position

g5252.definition: [ὑπερφρονέω] from {{g5228}} and {{g5426}}; to esteem oneself overmuch, i.e. be vain or arrogant

g5253.definition: [ὑπερῷον] neuter of a derivative of {{g5228}}; a higher part of the house, i.e. apartment in the third story

g5254.definition: [ὑπέχω] from {{g5259}} and {{g2192}}; to hold oneself under, i.e. endure with patience

g5255.definition: [ὑπήκοος] from {{g5219}}; attentively listening, i.e. (by implication) submissive

g5256.definition: [ὑπηρετέω] from {{g5257}}; to be a subordinate, i.e. (by implication) subserve

g5257.definition: [ὑπηρέτης] from {{g5259}} and a derivative of ἐρέσσω (to row); an under-oarsman, i.e. (generally) subordinate (assistant, sexton, constable)

g5258.definition: [ὕπνος] from an obsolete primary (perhaps akin to {{g5259}} through the idea of subsilience); sleep, i.e. (figuratively) spiritual torpor

g5259.definition: [ὑπό] a primary preposition; under, i.e. (with the genitive case) of place (beneath), or with verbs (the agency or means, through); (with the accusative case) of place (whither (underneath) or where (below) or time (when (at)) In the comparative, it retains the same general applications, especially of inferior position or condition, and specially, covertly or moderately.

g5260.definition: [ὑποβάλλω] from {{g5259}} and {{g906}}; to throw in stealthily, i.e. introduce by collusion

g5261.definition: [ὑπογραμμός] from a compound of {{g5259}} and {{g1125}}; an underwriting, i.e. copy for imitation (figuratively)

g5262.definition: [ὑπόδειγμα] from {{g5263}}; an exhibit for imitation or warning (figuratively, specimen, adumbration)

g5263.definition: [ὑποδείκνυμι] from {{g5259}} and {{g1166}}; to exhibit under the eyes, i.e. (figuratively) to exemplify (instruct, admonish)

g5264.definition: [ὑποδέχομαι] from {{g5259}} and {{g1209}}; to admit under one's roof, i.e. entertain hospitably

g5265.definition: [ὑποδέω] from {{g5259}} and {{g1210}}; to bind under one's feet, i.e. put on shoes or sandals

g5266.definition: [ὑπόδημα] from {{g5265}}; something bound under the feet, i.e. a shoe or sandal

g5267.definition: [ὑπόδικος] from {{g5259}} and {{g1349}}; under sentence, i.e. (by implication) condemned

g5268.definition: [ὑποζύγιον] neuter of a compound of {{g5259}} and {{g2218}}; an animal under the yoke (draught-beast), i.e. (specially), a donkey

g5269.definition: [ὑποζώννυμι] from {{g5259}} and {{g2224}}; to gird under, i.e. frap (a vessel with cables across the keel, sides and deck)

g5270.definition: [ὑποκάτω] from {{g5259}} and {{g2736}}; down under, i.e. beneath

g5271.definition: [ὑποκρίνομαι] middle voice from {{g5259}} and {{g2919}}; to decide (speak or act) under a false part, i.e. (figuratively) dissemble (pretend)

g5272.definition: [ὑπόκρισις] from {{g5271}}; acting under a feigned part, i.e. (figuratively) deceit ("hypocrisy")

g5273.definition: [ὑποκριτής] from {{g5271}}; an actor under an assumed character (stage-player), i.e. (figuratively) a dissembler ("hypocrite"

g5274.definition: [ὑπολαμβάνω] from {{g5259}} and {{g2983}}; to take from below, i.e. carry upward; figuratively, to take up, i.e. continue a discourse or topic; mentally, to assume (presume)

g5275.definition: [ὑπολείπω] from {{g5295}} and {{g3007}}; to leave under (behind), i.e. (passively) to remain (survive)

g5276.definition: [ὑπολήνιον] neuter of a presumed compound of {{g5259}} and {{g3025}}; vessel or receptacle under the press, i.e. lower wine-vat

g5277.definition: [ὑπολιμπάνω] a prolonged form for {{g5275}}; to leave behind, i.e. bequeath

g5278.definition: [ὑπομένω] from {{g5259}} and {{g3306}}; to stay under (behind), i.e. remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. bear (trials), have fortitude, persevere

g5279.definition: [ὑπομιμνήσκω] from {{g5259}} and {{g3403}}; to remind quietly, i.e. suggest to the (middle voice, one's own) memory

g5282.definition: [ὑπονοέω] from {{g5259}} and {{g3539}}; to think under (privately), i.e. to surmise or conjecture

g5284.definition: [ὑποπλέω] from {{g5259}} and {{g4126}}; to sail under the lee of

g5285.definition: [ὑποπνέω] from {{g5259}} and {{g4154}}; to breathe gently, i.e. breeze

g5286.definition: [ὑποπόδιον] neuter of a compound of {{g5259}} and {{g4228}}; something under the feet, i.e. a foot-rest (figuratively)

g5287.definition: [ὑπόστασις] from a compound of {{g5259}} and {{g2476}}; a setting under (support), i.e. (figuratively) concretely, essence, or abstractly, assurance (objectively or subjectively)

g5288.definition: [ὑποστέλλω] from {{g5259}} and {{g4724}}; to withhold under (out of sight), i.e. (reflexively) to cower or shrink, (figuratively) to conceal (reserve)

g5290.definition: [ὑποστρέφω] from {{g5259}} and {{g4762}}; to turn under (behind), i.e. to return (literally or figuratively)

g5291.definition: [ὑποστρώννυμι] from {{g5259}} and {{g4766}}; to strew underneath (the feet as a carpet)

g5293.definition: [ὑποτάσσω] from {{g5259}} and {{g5021}}; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey

g5294.definition: [ὑποτίθημι] from {{g5259}} and {{g5087}}; to place underneath, i.e. (figuratively) to hazard, (reflexively) to suggest

g5295.definition: [ὑποτρέχω] from {{g5259}} and {{g5143}} (including its alternate); to run under, i.e. (specially), to sail past

g5296.definition: [ὑποτύπωσις] from a compound of {{g5259}} and a derivative of {{g5179}}; typification under (after), i.e. (concretely) a sketch (figuratively) for imitation

g5297.definition: [ὑποφέρω] from {{g5259}} and {{g5342}}; to bear from underneath, i.e. (figuratively) to undergo hardship

g5298.definition: [ὑποχωρέω] from {{g5259}} and {{g5562}}; to vacate down, i.e. retire quietly

g5299.definition: [ὑπωπιάζω] from a compound of {{g5259}} and a derivative of {{g3700}}; to hit under the eye (buffet or disable an antagonist as a pugilist), i.e. (figuratively) to tease or annoy (into compliance), subdue (one's passions)

g5300.definition: [ὗς] apparently a primary word; a hog ("swine")
